TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name / Click the "Continue" button to start the experiment.
A micropipette is taken and the volume is adjusted to 20 microlitre.
notext
A fresh tip is inserted.
The bottle labeled as 1X Assay Buffer is opened.
20 microlitre of 1X Assay Buffer is pipetted out.
The vial labeled as 1:2 is taken from the ice box.
The vial labeled as 1:2 is taken from the ice box.
20 micro litre of the Assay Buffer in the micropipette is transferred to the vial.
The vial is kept back in the ice box.
Again, the bottle labeled as 1X Assay Buffer is opened.
20 micro litre of Assay Buffer is pipetted out.
notext
The vial labeled as 1:4 is taken from the ice box.
20 micro litre of the Assay Buffer in the micropipette is transferred to the vial.
The same procedure is repeated for the rest of the vials labeled up to 1:32.
The used tip is discarded.
The volume is adjusted to 20 micro litre.
A fresh tip is inserted.
The vial labeled as antiserum is taken from the ice box.
The cap of the vial is opened and pipette out 20 µl of antiserum.
The vial is kept back in the ice box.
The vial labeled as neat is taken from the ice box.
20 micro litre of the antiserum in the micropipette is transferred to the vial.
The vial is placed back on the ice box.
The vial labeled as antiserum is taken from the ice box.
Again, 20 microlitre of antiserum is pipetted out from the vial.
The vial is placed back on the ice box.
The vial labeled as 1:2 is taken from the ice box.
20 micro litre of the antiserum is transferred to the vial and mixed well to get a dilution of 1:2.
20 microlitre of solution is pipetted out from the same vial.
The vial is kept back in the ice box.
The vial labeled as 1:4 is taken from the ice box.
20 micro litre of the solution pipetted out from the vial labeled as 1:2 is now transferred to the vial labeled as 1:4 and is kept back in the ice box.
The used tip is discarded.
A fresh tip is inserted.
Now, the vial labeled as 1:4 is taken from the ice box.
The solution in the vial is mixed well, the dilution in the vial is 1:4 and pipetted out 20 microlitre of solution from the same vial.
The vial is kept back in the ice box.
The same procedure is repeated for the rest of the vials labeled up to 1:32.
The used tip is discarded.
notext
A weighing paper is placed on the weighing balance.
The bottle containing agarose is opened.
0.10g of agrose is weighed out.
The weighed agarose is then transferred to a conical flask.
The bottle labeled as 1X assay buffer is taken.
and 10 ml is measured in a measuring cylinder.
10 ml of the measured assay buffer is poured into the conical flask containing agarose.
The solution is mixed by gentle shaking.
The conical flask containing agarose is kept in a microwave oven for 2 minutes to make the agarose soluble.
After 2 minutes, the conical flask is taken out and the solution is allowed to cool for sometime.
notext
A glass plate is placed on a paper.
5ml of the agarose solution is poured onto the gel plate.
The agarose is allowed to set for 30 minutes. Now,the template is taken and is placed on a paper.
Take the gel punch with syringe.
Hold the tip of the gel puncher and place it on the gel corresponding to the markings on the template.
Then the piston is pulled up slowly so that part of the gel gets into the tube of the puncher making wells in the gel.
Accordingly, seven wells are made on the gel.
Now, the wells are marked on opposite side of the plate with a marker.
The micropipette is taken and the volume is adjusted to 10 micro litre.
A fresh tip is inserted.
The vial labeled as antigen is taken from the ice box.
10micro litre of antigen solution is pipetted out.
The vial is kept back in the ice box.
The well labeled as antigen(Ag) is filled with the 10 microlitre of antigen solution taken in the micropipette.
The used tip is discarded.
A fresh tip is inserted.
notext
The vial labeled as neat is taken from the ice box.
The well labeled as neat is filled with the 10 microlitre of antiserum solution taken in the micropipette.
The same procedure is repeated for all the wells labeled from 1:2 through 1:32.
A Petri plate is opened and a small piece of cotton is placed inside it.
A small volume of water is squeezed from the wash bottle onto the cotton to make it wet.
The gel plate is taken and is kept inside the chamber.
The lid of the plate is closed and is incubated overnight at room temperature.
notext
notext
